critique: The document is a presidential order regarding land use in Hawaii. It sets aside land ceded to the United States for federal use, subject to existing rights and rights-of-way for the State of Hawaii. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, or economic regulation. The order does expand executive power by setting aside land for federal use. It also leans towards federal primacy by asserting federal control over the land. There is no mention of security or liberty concerns, or social inclusion.
